item.title: Cape Town Adventures - Robben Island
item.description:
Cape Town Adventures - Robben Island

There's nothing like it! The feeling of waking up and feeling excited about what today has in store for you. I was going to visit Robben Island. The prison island where Nelson Mandela had been imprisoned for so many years of his life. As soon as I got up, I got ready to go out.

item.title: Mauritius Through Their Eyes
item.description:
Mauritius Through Their Eyes

When you think about Mauritius you think of a stunning island with white sandy beaches, palm trees and resorts. A little over a year ago, I started to follow 2 brothers, who live in Mauritius, on Instagram. @bastienhere (Sebastien To) and @fabouls (Fabrice To).

item.title: I Have This Strong Desire To Travel
item.description:
I Have This Strong Desire To Travel

My recently gifted diary had this title: " I have this strong desire to travel". It's something that many people just dream about. What is this urge all about? I tried to break my desire down to the following. I love to traveling to new places.

item.title: Explore Cape Town - Simon's Town to Muizenberg
item.description:
Explore Cape Town - Simon's Town to Muizenberg

On the eastern side of the Cape Peninsula, you'll find the most beautiful little towns that are worth exploring. I started all the way down at Boulders Beach, which is located near Simon's town. Boulders Beach is where you'll find the African Penguins. Have a look at my previous post to see more about them.

item.title: Top things to do in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
item.description:
Top things to do in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

We started our Vietnam trip with Ho Chi Minh City. We didn't expect much of it, because many people have said there isn't much to do. Upon arrival we quickly learned that "what people said" about Vietnam, turned out to be very subjective (more than normal).

item.title: Explore Cape Town - Penguins at Boulders Beach
item.description:
Explore Cape Town - Penguins at Boulders Beach

Yes, you read right! We have penguins in South Africa! They are called African Penguins and are native to South Africa. They were almost extinct, because of hunters and animals that killed them and are now very protected.When you go to see these penguins you have 2 options.
